title: 7 Reasons to Go On Druk Path Trek with Cultural Tour
text:
7 Reasons to Go On Druk Path Trek with Cultural Tour 7 Reasons to Go On Druk Path Trek with Cultural Tour 0 
The unique cultural authenticity of Bhutan draws people from far and near. Be it in the dressing style or the manner of conducting traditional ceremonies; the visitors are left with a flabbergasting feel of uniqueness. The cultural quotients of Bhutan tourism give a perfect balance to the quest for adventurism. If you are an avid trekker and an adventure lover; then you will have a whale of a time being out there in the middle of the rugged terrains. As you go trekking down the Druk Path, the scenic grandiloquence serves as your constant companion. 
Two leading factors 
Druk Path Trek doesn't have a huge distance to cover. It not only fulfills your quest for adventure but also serves as a gateway to the Bhutan cultural tours. As a tourist, you will have lots to gain. On the one hand, there is the brilliant opportunity for unraveling the sub-alpine folds of the mountains. On the other hand, there is an added feel of fascination. That's because, you know that the trekking experience creates the grounds for a deep-seated cultural interaction. The trekking journey that sets off from Paro doesn't take more than three days to come to a complete shape. 
A famous monastery 
You can make use of the duration to explore some of the major landmarks including Ta Dzong, the temple of Kichu Lhakhang and Rinpung Dzong. Hiking your way to the Taktsang Monastery is one of the leading attractions of the Bhutan cultural tours. The monastery happens to be the region's cultural icon. The fact that you can visit the monastery, in the course of your trekking does prove to be advantageous. You can quench you thirst for trekking. At the same time, you can catch a glimpse of the majestic mountains, emerald greenery and the uniquely isolated exuberance of the Taktsang (Tiger's Nest) Monastery. You need to trek the way to the monastery. Its location in the middle of the mountainous paths is such that it is accessible only by trekking. 
Unravels the monarchical lineage 
The brief but interesting trekking trip also paves the way for your interaction with the Wangyal Monstery. The latter is much acclaimed for its brilliant depiction of the current monarchy. In fact, the monastery unfolds elaborate paintings that reflect the pedigree of the Bhutan's monarchy. Both the monasteries drive you into a zone that is far from the maddening crowd's ugly strife. Once in a while, it does pay to be at peace, with yourself, in an ambiance that is blissfully serene. 
A complete package 
The trekking experience comes as a complete package. As said previously, you can mingle and interact with the finest frills of the natural world including the pine forest, alpine lake and the forests of rhododendrons. At the same time, you can catch a hurried glimpse of the temples, the exotic towns, villages, monasteries and the fortresses. You can take a meaningful break from the mundane mediocrity of the day-to-day life, and get an insight into the untainted culture of the Himalayan territory. With the visit to the Zorig Chusam (the institute of art and craft); you can bring the Bhutan Cultural Tours to their glorious conclusion.
